title: The Kingdom Divides
summary: Rehoboam becomes king after Solomon but refuses to ease the heavy burdens on the people. In response, ten tribes rebel and follow Jeroboam, forming the northern kingdom of Israel, while Rehoboam rules Judah.

faq.question: Why did the kingdom divide?
faq.answer: Rehoboam rejected wise counsel and increased the peopleâ€™s burdens.

faq.question: Who became king over the northern tribes?
faq.answer: Jeroboam, leading the new kingdom of Israel.
